item.title: Help with error when compiling
item.dc:creator: @Nintendo_G Nintendo_G
item.description:
@Nintendo_G wrote:

Eh Pretty Easy:

Why do you even have anticrash.java? Delete it.

I’m making one. It resets the server when it crashes by itself, I’m adding all of the reasons servers crash and making it automatically reset it if it happens.[br][size=1]Posted on: May 19, 2007, 06:16:10 AM[/size][hr]Here I’ve narrowed it down. Here are the first several lines of coding:

[code]import java.io.*;
public class anticrash{
public void println_debug(String str) {
if (println_debug(playerName+" is already online."))
{

public void resetserver()
{[/code]

Here’s the error I get:

anticrash.java:7: illegal start of expression public void resetserver() ^ 1 error Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

Cyclone:

Post da lines of code plz

I got a new error anyway. Here it is:

anticrash.java:3: illegal start of type
if println_debug(playerName+" is already online.")
^

if println_debug(playerName+" is already online.")
   ^
anticrash.java:3: <identifier> expected
if println_debug(playerName+" is already online.")
                           ^
anticrash.java:6: illegal start of expression
public void resetserver()
^

item.title: Help with error when compiling
item.dc:creator: @Nintendo_G Nintendo_G
item.description:
@Nintendo_G wrote:

I’m making a new anticrash java file but I get this error when compiling, I posted the lines of coding I’m having errors with. Does anybody know how to fix this?

Here’s the lines of coding:

[code]import java.io.*;
public class anticrash{
public void println_debug(String str) {
if (println_debug(playerName+" is already online."))
{

public void resetserver()
{[/code]

Here’s the error I get:

anticrash.java:7: illegal start of expression public void resetserver() ^ 1 error Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . .
